intro: Corydalis pseudoheterocentra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
